channel.title: [317] Run.bat problem, Wtf does this mean?
channel.description:
I was using kevenscapes source as a base and i was adding shops then i got this...
what do i do and what does it mean?
Kevescape server. Exception in thread "main" java.lang.numberformatexxception: For input string: "100" at java.lang.numberformantexception.forinputstring<unknown source> at java.lang.integer.parseint(unknown source) at java.lang.integer.parseint(unknown source) at shophandler.loadshops(shophandler.java:88) at shophandler.<init>(shophandler.java:33) at server.main(server.java:132)
Ok, so yea i looked in my shophandler, looked in shops.cfg, looked in client.java... it seems to all be fine. i compile and it says the normal -xlint thing so it has no errors.. but when i do run.bat it says that above.
The last thing i did was add the fishing equipment shop with the npc 308... but i dont think that helps...

item.title: [317] Run.bat problem, Wtf does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Excorsist Excorsist
item.description:
@Excorsist wrote:

If this occurred after adding a shop in then that would mean you have done it wrong. you can either remove that shop or fix it.

chances are you have used the space bar instead of the tab button.

in between the item you want in the shop and the amount you want in the shop you must press tab instead of spacebar.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Run.bat problem, Wtf does this mean?

item.title: [317] Run.bat problem, Wtf does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @i_weed_i1 i weed i_
item.description:
@i_weed_i1 wrote:

This means you made an error in a .Cfg file. You need to find that error and fix it then that will go away… Or redo shops all over again.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2009, 04:36:41 am[/size][hr]Because its not the run.bat’s problem, its the cfg file.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Run.bat problem, Wtf does this mean?
